info.description: Manages Data Qualiy Rules in Aladdin Data Cloud (ADC). Used by Dataset Owners and ADCQualityAnalysisServer.
info.title: Adc Quality Rule

post.description:
Creates an ADCQualityRule resource
it should not create again if already exist

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.

If quality rule does not exist, give error response not found

Id describes the computer or human assigned resource identifier.

delete.description:
For given id deletes adc quality rule. 
If quality rule does not exist give error response not found 
The endpoint performs a hard delete
Quality rules with the specified id will be deleted

post.description:
Deletes all adc quality rules for given list of ids
If quality rule does not exist give error response not found 
if it's valid, Quality rules with the specified ids
will be deleted with success response message
The endpoint performs a hard delete
post.summary: Deletes list of adc quality rules

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

v1AdcDatasetQualifiedName.title:
Composite key of database, schema, and dataset name providing a fully-
qualified schema object 
(see https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/name-resolution.html)

database.title: database name where the view is located

schema.title:
schema name where the view is located
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)

id.title:
Resources must have a 'id' field.
Id describes the computer or human assigned resource identifier.
Generated by ADCQualityRulesServer

database.title: Database name of the dataset on which quality rule is applied

schema.title: Schema name of the dataset on which quality rule is applied

datasetName.title: Dataset name of the dataset on which quality rule is applied

description.title: Short summary of the quality rule

ruleGroup.description:
Defines the rule group 
Rules can be for gap detection , schema conformance check etc.

rule.title:
Define the quality rule with important information
Includes comparison value, columns on which rule is applied among others

cronSchedules.title: Describes the schedule of the quality rule using cron expression

stopIngest.title: Describes if the quality rule can cause ingestion to fail

minAcceptanceRate.title: The minimum amount of rule checks on data that should pass; can have value between 0 and 1

creator.description: Represents user that created this record.

createTime.title: Create time for new resource request

modifier.description: Represents user that last modified this record.

modifyTime.title:
Modify time for new/edit resource request
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this field is not related to the cross-domain schema field --)

v1AppliedOnType.description:
- APPLIED_ON_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: No type specified
 - APPLIED_ON_TYPE_COLUMN_VALUE: Describes if the rule is applied on particular columns
 - APPLIED_ON_TYPE_ROW_COUNT: Describes if the rule is to test row count for data ingested
 - APPLIED_ON_TYPE_FILE_EXTENSION: Describes if the rule is applied on a file extension
 - APPLIED_ON_TYPE_FILE_SIZE: Describes if the rule is applied on a file size
 - APPLIED_ON_TYPE_SQL: Describes if rule is applied on sql
v1AppliedOnType.title: Describes where the quality rule is applied

v1BatchCreateAdcQualityRulesRequest.title:
Request message for creating AdcQualityRules in batches
can create max 500 adcQualityRules at once

results.title: list of the adc quality rules created

v1BatchDeleteAdcQualityRulesRequest.title:
The request message for AdcQualityRuleAPI.BatchDeleteAdcQualityRules.
can delete max 15 adcQualityRules at once

ids.title:
unique identifier for ADC Quality Rule
id of the quality rule to delete

results.description:
Results indicating success or error of the Delete operation
of the requests.

v1ComparisonDataType.description:
- COMPARISON_DATA_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: no comparison data type specified
 - COMPARISON_DATA_TYPE_INT: data type of comparison value is integer
 - COMPARISON_DATA_TYPE_LONG: data type of comparison value is long
 - COMPARISON_DATA_TYPE_STRING: data type of comparison value is string
 - COMPARISON_DATA_TYPE_DOUBLE: data type of comparison value is decimal
 - COMPARISON_DATA_TYPE_BOOLEAN: data type of comparison value is boolean
 - COMPARISON_DATA_TYPE_DATE: data type of comparison value is date
 - COMPARISON_DATA_TYPE_TIMESTAMP: data type of comparison value is timestamp
v1ComparisonDataType.title: Describes the data type of the comparison value

v1ComparisonType.description:
- COMPARISON_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Comparision type unspecified
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_EQUALS: specifies equals comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_NOT_EQUALS: specifies not equals comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_LESS_THAN: specifies less than comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_LESS_THAN_EQUAL_TO: specifies less than equal to comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_GREATER_THAN: specifies greater than comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_GREATER_THAN_EQUAL_TO: specifies greater than equal to comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_RANGE: specifies range comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_REGEX: specifies regex comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_UNIQUE: specifies unique comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_NON_NULLABLE: specifies nullability comparison in the quality rule
 - COMPARISON_TYPE_SQL: specifies sql based comparison in the quality rule
v1ComparisonType.title: describes the type of comparison

error.description: result in case of failure or cancellation.

output.description: Success response in form of adc quality rule.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

v1FilterAdcQualityRuleQuery.description:
The query required to perform a filter all adc quality rules based on different parameters.
Filter query can be used to get all rules for a dataset at a client based on criticality or activeness.

v1FilterAdcQualityRulesRequest.description: The request body of the filter adc quality rules call.

query.description: The query used to filter against adc quality rules, such as client abbreviation etc.

pageToken.description: The starting point of a query result.

pageSize.description:
The maximum number of adc quality rules to be returned per page of results.
The page size is 50. Otherwise, the maximum allowed page size is 10.

Default is 3 if empty or a number < 1 is specified.

v1FilterAdcQualityRulesResponse.description: The response for filter adc quality rules method.

adcQualityRules.description: The adc quality rule entities that match the specified FilterAdcQualityRulesRequest.

nextPageToken.description: A token to retrieve the next page of results.

v1OperatorType.description:
- OPERATOR_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: unspecified operator
 - OPERATOR_TYPE_MAX: adds max operator on the column
 - OPERATOR_TYPE_MIN: adds min operator on the column
 - OPERATOR_TYPE_COUNT: adds count operator on the column
 - OPERATOR_TYPE_AVG: adds average operator on the column
 - OPERATOR_TYPE_STANDARD_DEVIATION: adds standard deviation operator on the column
 - OPERATOR_TYPE_MODE: adds mode operator on the column
 - OPERATOR_TYPE_MEDIAN: adds median operator on the column
v1OperatorType.title: Defines the operator to be applied on the column

v1Rule.title: Rule describes the information needed by the analysis server to perform quality checks

appliedType.title: Describes if the rule is on a column, row_count or based on a sql

columnOperator.title: defines aggregrate operator on applied fields like max, min, avg, count if any

operatorValue.title: Specifies the value used for comparison by column operator

appliedFieldName.title: Describes the column name on which the rule is applied

comparisonType.title: Describes type of comparison to be applied on the field

comparisonPrimitiveType.title: Describes the data type of the comparison value

higherIndexRange.title: Determines the upper index of the range

lowerIndexRange.title: Determines the lower index of the range

isHigherIndexInclusive.title: Determines if the range includes the upper index

isLowerIndexInclusive.title: Determines if the range includes the lower index

sql.title: Describes the query to be run

lookBackPeriod.title: number of days on which SQL rule will be applied

errorMessage.title: error message when the rule fails

contactEmails.title: email addresses to contact when the rule fails

badRecordsSql.title: query to show bad records if rule fails

datadomain.title: Domain from where the data arrives

arrivalExtension.title: the extension with while file arrives

arrivalFolder.title: folder where the the file arrives

expectedFrequency.title: expected frequency of the file arrival

tableName.title: table name for the dataset in the snowflake

v1RuleGroup.description:
- RULE_GROUP_UNSPECIFIED: rule group not specified
 - RULE_GROUP_SCHEMA_CONFORMANCE: group for general schema based rules
 - RULE_GROUP_GAP_DETECTION: group for specific business use case rules
 - RULE_GROUP_ROW_COUNT_FREQUENCY: group for row count and frequency checks
v1RuleGroup.title: Defines the group under which rule falls

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
This grants access to all endpoints in the platform.studio.adc.adc_quality_rule.v1.AdcQualityRule API

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
This grants access to all endpoints in the platform.studio.adc.adc_quality_rule.v1.AdcQualityRule API
